WRITING.TITLE: Hi LGBT community - just came to ask... what do you think of the word 'gay' as slang?
WRITING.TEXT: I was born in the mid-90's and grew up at a time where the strive for LGBT equality was still pushing for real change. I am not LGBT, I am straight, but I am really passionate about equal rights for all. One of the worst things I do is say the word 'gay' as slang. Growing up everybody said it and you wouldn't even get in trouble for saying it in front of a teacher (I assume it's a lot different these days). While I now say it less I still occasionally will say it. What do you guys in general think of this word when used as slang to describe something not specifically gay? Personally I know it's bad because it's often used in a negative context and I try and stop myself but I see a lot to people equating it with the N-word which is think is a bit too far. The N-word was used to remind black people that whites once owned them and they were their property - the word gay used to (and still does to some extent) mean happy and was later used to describe homosexuals. Anyway want to hear people's opinions - I do know it's wrong at some level though and I'm trying to change it
Get Far Harbour no question

Boardwalk is one of the greatest shows of all time imo opinion but you really have to appreciate it as a whole - the great writing and sometimes irrelevant conversations, the authenticity, the history - it's a slow burn. It's a lot more classic gangster than Sopranos but one of the main writers of that show made Boardwalk so I don't think you will like it. Suits is garbage in comparison to this show

WRITING.TITLE: Holy shit - what an amazing campaign!!!
WRITING.TEXT: Spoilers - well for a game written by BJ Blazkowicz, and Nick Reyes, himself this was pretty emotional. The last couple missions were so great the feeling of impending doom. The way everyone sacrifices themselves one by one (even that pilot who flew into the AA gun without question got me upset). When the quartermaster stays behind, or the chief sacrifices herself, don't even get me started on Ethan! Ballsey to kill off most of the cast and some of those recordings at the end brought me to the point of tears. Kash, Ethan and the Quartermasters one - oh god hold me!!! Overall hugely surprising and very emotional I am so pissed off that this is the Call of Duty people are voicing anger at - it's the best one in years!!!

I'm doing history at university. We are reading old top secret transcripts from the Kennedy, Johnson, Nixon and Ford administrations where they talk with their staff. Every time I read it I imagine what Donald Trump would have said during the Tet offensive, fall of Saigon, the Yom Kippur war, the overthrow of Diem and I die a little inside. How can we go from all these smart (even Nixon as corrupt as he was) to a complete and utter moron !?
Side note - Bush Jr's transcripts are still classified but even he would understand things way better than Trump-and bush was an idiot

WRITING.TITLE: Running vs cycling
WRITING.TEXT:
So sorry if this isn't the right place to ask but feel it's relevant. So recently I've started playing soccer again and combining with my old running schedule it's brought out some bad injuries. I keep getting muscle strains and the like popping up in different places when I try and run every so often. So I am falling back on cycling when my body can't handle running.
I usually run for fitness and to keep in shape - my question is - is burning 500 calories in a cycle the same as a run? I know it sounds dumb but as running helps burn fat around you stomach - does cycling do something similar ? Or does it just workout your legs ? What is the major downside of cycling over running ?
I am abit of a noob but a replay would be appreciated from anyone !
